result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin P. Reinke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
May have contact with Marco Mancilla if he requests it.

records.addlTxt: Amended
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Watson acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions, concurrent on cts 1 & 2; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $400 DNA surcharge.  Expunction hearing set for 3/24/17 at 8:30am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo for Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Attorney Rufo is requesting an adjournment - offer was recently received & needs to be discussed w/ the DE.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Kristyne Watson  kmk

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states she just took over the case from Atty Lassiter and has a new offer to discuss further w/deft.  FPT continued to 2/3/16 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter states she needs time to make a counter offer to the State.  FPT continued to 1/11/16 at 2pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Ayers the FPT of 12/1/15 at 9am is rescheduled, due to a conflict w/a trial proceeding on this date; reset to 12/3/15 at 3pm; Atty Ayers to attempt to notify deft.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiters states she just received a new offer today that the deft needs time to consider.  FPT continued to 12/1/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Defendant, Colin P Reinke, appeared with Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.
